Returns: A linear interpolation between the start and end values, given the fraction parameter.
Parameters: float: The fraction from the starting to the ending values
Integer: The start value; should be of type int or Integer
Integer: The end value; should be of type int or Integer
evaluate(float,java.lang.Integer,java.la.Description: This function returns the result of linearly interpolating the start and end values, with fraction representing the proportion between the start and end values. The calculation is a simple parametric calculation: result = x0 + t * (x1 - x0), where x0 is startValue, x1 is endValue, and t is fraction.
evaluate(float,java.lang.Integer,java.la.FullName: public Integer evaluate (float fraction, Integer startValue, Integer endValue)

ClassDesc: This evaluator can be used to perform type interpolation between int values.
